_header: In the land of More Brittany

BodRawK42.First Lines:
IN the londe of more bretayngneSchal ben a lorde of gret
                    renomeIn whos tyme as bokys seyneSchal be tresoun in toure and
                    towne…
BodRawK42.Last Lines:
…Thys Englonde bretayne calle may ȝeWhenne thys tyme ys
                    commyn & gonne
BodRawK42.Note:
Eleven quatrains only; two parchment leaves inserted in Hearne’s
                    transcripts (note shelf mark changed by Bodleian).
BodRawK42.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Geoffrey of Monmouth: an English Fragment.” 
             English Studies
         38 (1957): 259-62: 261-2.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 113-15.

BodRawC813.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 215.

BLSl2578.First Lines: A deede man of xv in þe lande of more bryteineshalbe a Lorde of greate renownein whose tyme as bookes sayenshalbe traison in tower and towne…
BLSl2578.Last Lines: …this england Brytein call wewhen þat þis tyme come is & gone
BLSl2578.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 215. Written as prose; eleven quatrains, with end marked by a line drawn between last line and beginning of next text on f. 51.
